title: --testnet flag does not work: Chain not started, listening for genesis block
body:
**Describe the bug**
I cannot seem to figure out how to connect to the Medalla or Altona testnets.

**Expected behavior**
Run `lodestar beacon run --testnet altona` to connect to the testnet.

**Steps to Reproduce**
1. Run `lodestar beacon run --testnet altona`
2. Read `2020-08-03 00:34:49  [CHAIN]            info: Chain not started, listening for genesis block`

```
❯ lodestar beacon run --testnet altona --eth1.enabled true --eth1.provider.url http://localhost:8545 --eth1.provider.network 5 --eth1.depositContract.deployedAt 2917810 --eth1.depositContract.address 0x16e82D77882A663454Ef928
06b7DeCa1D394810f --rootDir $HOME/.altona                                                                                                                                                                                        2020-08-03 00:34:49  [NODE]             info: Starting eth2 beacon node - LODESTAR!                                                                                                                                              
2020-08-03 00:34:49  [DB]               info: Connected to LevelDB database at /home/user/.altona/beacon/chain-db      
2020-08-03 00:34:49  [CHAIN]            info: Chain not started, listening for genesis block                                                                                                                                     
2020-08-03 00:35:00  [ETH1]             info: Started listening to eth1 provider http://localhost:8545 on chain 5        
2020-08-03 00:35:00  [ETH1]             info: Processing eth1 blocks from 2917811 to 3155721 
```

It then keeps scanning for eth1 blocks and cannot determine the genesis even though this happened weeks ago.


**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: ArchLinux
 - Branch: `master`
 - Commit hash: 02d82b2d550c596fa91ced65194ccb9c33f58175

```
~/.opt/chainsafe/lodestar master
❯ lodestar beacon init --testnet altona --eth1.enabled true --eth1.provider.url http://localhost:8545 --eth1.provider.network 5 --eth1.depositContract.deployedAt 2917810 --eth1.depositContract.address 0x16e82D77882A663454Ef92806b7DeCa1D394810f --rootDir $HOME/.lodestar

~/.opt/chainsafe/lodestar master
❯ lodestar beacon run --testnet altona --eth1.enabled true --eth1.provider.url http://localhost:8545 --eth1.provider.network 5 --eth1.depositContract.deployedAt 2917810 --eth1.depositContract.address 0x16e82D77882A663454Ef92806b7DeCa1D394810f --rootDir $HOME/.lodestar
2020-08-03 00:53:34  [NODE]             info: Starting eth2 beacon node - LODESTAR! 
2020-08-03 00:53:34  [DB]               info: Connected to LevelDB database at /home/user/.lodestar/beacon/chain-db 
2020-08-03 00:53:34  [CHAIN]            info: Chain not started, listening for genesis block 
2020-08-03 00:53:44  [ETH1]             info: Started listening to eth1 provider http://localhost:8545 on chain 5 
2020-08-03 00:53:44  [ETH1]             info: Processing eth1 blocks from 2917811 to 3155796
```

The eth1 node is a local goerli node (geth).
Eth1 genesis state generation is buggy at the moment. It is recommended to disable eth1 for now until the underlying issues are addressed
--testnet flag now works correctly, no longer need to create genesis from deposits.
